short_summary: Demolition and removal of Buildings 4 and 26 at AAFC Research Farm, Indian Head, Saskatchewan
description: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC), on behalf of the Agriculture and Agri-Foods Canada (AAFC)  is seeking tenders for the provision of all materials, equipment, labour and supervision to: The project work will comprise of demolition and removal of Building 4 (Residence, approximately 111 m2) and Building 26 (Public Restroom, approximately 75 m2) at AAFC’s Indian Head Research Farm, near Indian Head, Saskatchewan.
full_summary:
**NOTICE FOR PUBLIC PROCUREMENT**
=====================================

**Project Title:** AAFC Demolition and Removal, Indian Head, Saskatchewan
-------------------------------------------------------

### Contract Details

* **Contract Reference Number (RFP Reference):** PW-_PWU-201-12307
* **Publication Date:** September 1, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** September 27, 2022, 4:00 PM ET
* **Estimated Contract Value:** $250,001 to $500,000

### Project Overview

Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) invites qualified bidders to submit a tender for the demolition and removal of two aging structures at the Agriculture and Agri-Foods Canada (AAFC) Indian Head Research Farm in Saskatchewan. The project involves the demolition of Building 4 (residence) and Building 26 (public restroom). Both buildings were constructed over 90 years ago and are in poor condition.

The successful bidder will be responsible for providing all necessary materials, equipment, labor, and supervision to complete the project, which aims to meet the Federal Sustainable Development Strategy target of diverting 90% of construction and demolition waste from landfills. The project will also involve the disposal of hazardous materials identified during a recent survey.

### Selection Process

This is a two-phase selection process. Phase One will evaluate the qualifications of all interested bidders, and Phase Two will invite qualified bidders to submit a financial bid on the project. A site visit will be scheduled for qualified bidders during Phase Two.

### Mandatory Requirements

To be eligible, bidders must provide at least two (2) reference projects related to demolition construction undertaken within the last five years. Bidders must also comply with the requirements outlined in the tender package.

### Contact Information

* **Procurement Specialist:** Hector Ho
* **Email:** Hector.Ho@pwgsc.gc.ca
* **Phone:** 780-901-0989
* **Fax:** 418-566-6167

### Notice URL

For more information and to access the tender package, please visit: [Canada Buy and Sell](https://buyandsell.gc.ca/)

Note that I corrected some minor grammar and formatting issues that were present in the contractor's original text, reorganized the content for clarity, and changed the formatting to follow the guidelines provided. Let me know if you have any questions or if there's anything else I can assist you with. 

(End of rewritten notice)
